title: How to Make Gluten Free Peanut Butter Cookies

steps.headline: While you preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180°C), line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
steps.description: You will need to place baking weights or some other weights on the corner of the cookie sheet to keep the parchment paper from curling while you bake. If you don’t have baking weights, then scrap the parchment paper and coat the sheet with a bit of butter. Since this recipe makes 3 dozen cookies, you will have to reuse the same cookie sheet three times unless you have more than one, and all of them fit comfortably in your oven.

steps.headline: Combine the egg, sugar and baking soda in a mixing bowl until the ingredients are well-combined.
steps.description: Use either a stand mixer with a paddle attachment or a handheld mixer.

steps.headline: Beat in the peanut butter and the vanilla extract.
steps.description: When all of the ingredients are well-combined, turn off the mixer. Make sure to turn off the mixer while the blades are still in the dough. This will keep you from spraying dough all over your countertop.

steps.headline: Place some sugar in a shallow bowl.
Scoop a heaping tablespoon of dough from the bowl and roll it into a round ball that is about 1" (2 1/2 centimeters) in diameter.
Using your clean fingers, roll the dough in the sugar
Place the sugared ball of dough on the cookie sheet.
Press the back of a fork across the center of 1 dough ball.
Press the back of the fork perpendicular across the center of your first fork impression.
steps.description: This will create a crosshatch pattern on top of each cookie.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 10 minutes or until the cookies are lightly set.
Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool for 2 minutes.
Use a spatula to remove the cookies from the cookie sheet.
Place the cookies on wire racks to cool.

text: Prepare the Dough While you preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180°C), line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. You will need to place baking weights or some other weights on the corner of the cookie sheet to keep the parchment paper from curling while you bake. If you don’t have baking weights, then scrap the parchment paper and coat the sheet with a bit of butter. Since this recipe makes 3 dozen cookies, you will have to reuse the same cookie sheet three times unless you have more than one, and all of them fit comfortably in your oven. Combine the egg, sugar and baking soda in a mixing bowl until the ingredients are well-combined. Use either a stand mixer with a paddle attachment or a handheld mixer. Beat in the peanut butter and the vanilla extract. When all of the ingredients are well-combined, turn off the mixer. Make sure to turn off the mixer while the blades are still in the dough. This will keep you from spraying dough all over your countertop. Assemble the Cookies Place some sugar in a shallow bowl.  Scoop a heaping tablespoon of dough from the bowl and roll it into a round ball that is about 1" (2 1/2 centimeters) in diameter.  Using your clean fingers, roll the dough in the sugar  Place the sugared ball of dough on the cookie sheet.  Press the back of a fork across the center of 1 dough ball.  Press the back of the fork perpendicular across the center of your first fork impression. This will create a crosshatch pattern on top of each cookie. Bake and Serve the Cookies Bake the cookies for 10 minutes or until the cookies are lightly set.  Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool for 2 minutes.  Use a spatula to remove the cookies from the cookie sheet.  Place the cookies on wire racks to cool.
